intro: Banksia stuposa, commonly known as the narrow-leaf banksia, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Western Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical flower spikes, which are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant produces woody cones that contain seeds, a feature common among many members of the Proteaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the dry, Mediterranean climate of its native region. Banksia stuposa plays an important ecological role, providing food and habitat for various native wildlife species.
